official-title.#text: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to include vaccines against seasonal influenza within the definition of taxable vaccines.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives June 18, 2013.

header.#text: Addition of vaccines against seasonal influenza to list of taxable vaccines

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

quote.#text: or any other vaccine against seasonal influenza

text.#text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to sales and uses on or after the later of—
the first day of the first month which begins more than 4 weeks after the date of the enactment of this Act, or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: lists any vaccine against seasonal influenza (other than any vaccine against seasonal influenza listed by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: prior to the date of the enactment of this Act) for purposes of compensation for any vaccine-related injury or death through the Vaccine Injury Compensation Trust Fund.
, in the case of sales on or before the effective date described in such paragraph for which delivery is made after such date, the delivery date shall be considered the sale date.

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 475 EH: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to include vaccines against seasonal influenza within the definition of taxable vaccines.
